text:
When installing Apache on Windows Xp SP3, all is correct.
The Log system is turn to debug.

Here is the error I have :

[Thu Aug 06 02:11:07 2009] [info] [client 127.0.0.1] (OS 10014)Le système a détecté une adresse de pointeur non valide en essayant d'utiliser un argument pointeur dans un appel.  : core_output_filter: writing data to the network


Can't find any resource about "OS 10014" error.

I try to put EnableMMAP off and EnableSendfile off, but the error is till there.

PHP files are not interpreted, browser only propose to download them.
HTML file are not interpreted, I only have Blank screen.

Using Apache2 for years, And I can't find any issue for this.

Thanks in advance.
creator: regis.tedone@free.fr
ben.ricker@gmail.com
text:
I am seeing the same issue under a load test. Using 2.2.9 on Windows 2003. Will sustain 90-100 requests a second and then start dropping after the OS 10014 error gets logged. Then requests stop coming and I have to restart Apache. 

One difference that may or may not be related is that I turned disabled the WinSock2 API: "Disabled use of AcceptEx() WinSock2 API" due to issues with the error associated with it.

creator: ben.ricker@gmail.com
text: Looking at some other debug reports, there may be another issue with using PHP. Not sure about the first reporter, but we are using PHP 5.2.1.

creator: toscano.luca@gmail.com
text: This bug has been in NEEDINFO for 4 years (and opened way before in 2009), I am inclined to close it but please re-open it if the issue is still present.
